intro: Buchnera pinnata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed broom, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Buchnera pinnata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
